info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 2:41PM EDT until July 14 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lowland flooding will begin along the Connecticut River near Thompsonville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EDT Thursday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 14.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 10/16/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EDT.
